info.name: 01 - RESTful API Fundamentals
info.description:
# 01 - RESTful API Fundamentals

## Overview

This collection demonstrates core RESTful API testing skills using JSONPlaceholder, a free fake API for testing and prototyping. It covers all fundamental CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete) with comprehensive test validation.

## API Used

- **jsonplaceholder_url:** [https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com](https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com)
    
- **Documentation**: [https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/guide/](https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/guide/)
    

## Features Demonstrated

- ✅ GET requests with and without parameters
    
- ✅ POST requests with static and dynamic data
    
- ✅ PUT requests (full updates)
    
- ✅ PATCH requests (partial updates)
    
- ✅ DELETE requests
    
- ✅ Response validation (status codes, data types, structure)
    
- ✅ Response time testing
    
- ✅ Data extraction and variable storage
    
- ✅ Email format validation with regex
    
- ✅ Array and object validation
    
- ✅ Dynamic data generation using Postman variables
    

## Collection Contents

### 1\. GET All Posts

- Retrieves all posts from the API
    
- Validates response is an array with 100+ elements
    
- Extracts and saves first user ID for later use
    
- Tests each post has required fields (userId, id, title, body)
    

### 2\. GET Single Post

- Retrieves a specific post by ID
    
- Validates response structure and data types
    
- Confirms correct post ID is returned
    

### 3\. GET Post Comments

- Retrieves all comments for a specific post
    
- Validates all comments belong to the correct post
    
- Tests email format using regex validation
    
- Logs total comment count
    

### 4\. GET with Query Parameters

- Demonstrates filtering posts by userId
    
- Validates query parameter filtering works correctly
    
- Includes random post selection for testing variety
    

### 5\. Create New Post

- Creates a new post with static data
    
- Validates 201 Created status code
    
- Confirms response contains all submitted data
    
- Saves created post ID for later operations
    

### 6\. Create New Post with Dynamic Data

- Uses Postman's built-in variables for dynamic content
    
- Generates random titles and body content
    
- Validates dynamic data is correctly stored
    

### 7\. Update Entire Post (PUT)

- Demonstrates full resource update
    
- Uses dynamic data generation
    
- Validates all fields are updated correctly
    

### 8\. Partial Update Post (PATCH)

- Updates only the title field
    
- Validates other fields remain unchanged
    
- Shows difference between PUT and PATCH
    

### 9\. Delete Post

- Removes a post by ID
    
- Validates successful deletion (200 status)
    
- Confirms empty response body
    

## Test Coverage

- Status code validation (200, 201)
    
- Response time performance testing (< 1000ms)
    
- Data type validation (arrays, objects, strings, numbers)
    
- Field existence and structure validation
    
- Email format validation using regex
    
- Dynamic data generation and validation
    
- Collection variable management
    

## Variables Used

| Variable | Purpose |
| --- | --- |
| `jsonplaceholder_url` | API base URL ([https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com](https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com)) |
| `firstUserId` | Stores first user ID from responses |
| `firstPostId` | Stores created post ID |
| `postTitle` | Dynamic post title |
| `postBody` | Dynamic post body content |

## How to Run

1. Set the `jsonplaceholder_url` collection variable to: `https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com`
    
2. Run the entire collection using Collection Runner
    
3. Review test results in the Test Results tab
    
4. Check console for detailed logging output
    

## Prerequisites

- Postman Desktop App or Postman Web
    
- Internet connection
    
- No authentication required
    

## Skills Showcased

- RESTful API testing fundamentals
    
- HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE)
    
- Test script writing in JavaScript
    
- Response validation and assertions
    
- Dynamic data generation
    
- Variable management and data flow
    
- Regex pattern matching
    
- Pre-request and test scripts

pm.test("Array contains at least 100 elements", function () {
